object.name: Arquebus

object.description: A scaled down mortar deigned to shoot bombs or other large projectiles.  Any fumble while reloading the weapon causes it to explode.
object.name: Hand Mortar

object.description: A small vial of yellow dye. Enough to change colour of a single set of cloths.
object.name: Dye - Yellow

object.description: Helps you count.
object.name: Abacus

object.description: Usually include items such as: quadrant, charts compass, hourglass.
object.name: Trade Tools - Navigator

object.description: 1 sheet of parchment.
object.name: Parchment

object.description: A large sheet of canvas.
object.name: Canvas Tarp

object.description: A unique work of art. This prosthetics completely replaces lost body part allowing you to ignore and any penalties due to missing body part. If you receive a critical hit in it, it automatically breaks and needs to be repaired by a specialist for at least 10% of the base cost (depends on the damage).
object.name: Engineering Marvel

object.description: Made of wood from Starfire tree, these arrows often set targets ablaze.
object.name: Starfire Shafts

object.description:
Rudimentary compass made out of metal needle balanced on a pin. Gives +2 SL to Navigation Tests where knowing which direction is
north is relevant.
object.name: Compass

object.description: Not as well balanced as sword but good against armor.
object.name: Axe

object.description: A regular sword. Well balanced.
object.name: Sword

object.description: A long thin spike on top of a spear shaft.
object.name: Ahlspiess

object.description: A Polearm with a semi-circular top with spikes on the inner side. Can be used to trap someone's neck.
object.name: Mancatcher

object.description: Special arrowhead designed to penetrate armor.
object.name: Bodkin Arrow

object.description: Shoots 6 projectiles at a time. Reloading is very difficult and requires 6 bullets and doses of gunpowder.
object.name: Griffonsfoot Pistol

object.description: A simpler form of a Repeater Pistol. After each shot it has to be manually rotated, cranked, or otherwise manually prepared to fire again. Because of that it needs a second hand to operate or it loses its Repeater Quality.
object.name: Pepperbox

object.description: Can be loaded to large guns such as Arquebus or Hand Mortar. When fired, anyone within 2 yards (including the shooter) has to make Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain a Deafened Condition.
object.name: Large Bullet and Powder

object.description: A type of longsword. It is a great sword with two-handed grip, usually 5 ft long, and weighing over 4 lb.
object.name: Zweihander

object.description: Pair of average quality gloves.
object.name: Gloves

object.description: May contains plays, poems, etc. Can also include texts about various techniques such as: perspective, sculpturing technique, lighting, or similar.
object.name: Book - Art

object.description: Curved blade similar to Scimitar but a bit more straight and longer. Can be used on foot with Melee - Basic skill but with Slash (2A) instead of Slash (1A) or with Melee - Fencing in which case it retains Slash (1A) Quality.
object.name: Sabre

object.description: A pigs bladder filled with a volatile lighter-than-air gas.
object.name: Bladder of Liftgas

object.description: Ammunition for bows.
object.name: Arrow

object.description: Thrown weapon made out of string and weights designed to entangle the target.
object.name: Bolas

object.description: White face powder used for makeup.
object.name: Face powder

object.description: Optical instrument for observing distant objects. User gets +20 to Perception Tests to see distant objects.
object.name: Telescope

object.description: Has enough oil for 4 hours or 8 hours of low flame (like a candle).
object.name: Lamp Oil

object.description: A simple amulet.
object.name: Amulet

object.description: Grain flail modified to be a weapon.
object.name: Grain Flail

object.description: Early design of a handgun. Before shooting, the user has to spend 1 Action to light the fuse.
object.name: Matchlock Handgun

object.description: Pre-prepared packages of shot and powder, make reloading easier. Give +10 bonus to all reload Tests.
object.name: Paper Cartridge

object.description: A pair of shoes.
object.name: Shoes

object.description: A small bottle of perfumes.
object.name: Perfume

object.description: A set of artisan tools. Varies per trade. For example carpenter has hammer and nails, saw, etc. Engraver has gravers, punches, wax, acid, and similar. Smith's tools include hammer, tongs, etc.
object.name: Trade Tools - Artisan

object.description: Foot prosthetic. Equipping false foot let's you ignore 1 point of Movement Loss due to missing foot. For 100 XP you can become so proficient in using it that you can ignore another point of Movement Loss. For extra 200 XP you can use Dodge again.
object.name: False Foot

object.description: A simple legal document.
object.name: Legal Document

object.description: Can fit 4 people in.
object.name: Tent - Medium

object.description: Lighter than usual Empire spears, they have sharper points capable of piercing armour.
object.name: Eonir Spear

object.description: Finely made and carefully reinforced. Compared to Empire weapons, they are less prone to misfires and more lethal to the enemy.
object.name: Dwarf Handgun

object.description: Device to measure angles over large distances. Requires Trade - Cartographer to use it.
object.name: Theodolite

object.description: A leather belt that is worn diagonally, with multiple small containers hanging from it.
object.name: Bandoleer

object.description: Flammable string use to detonate black powder from a distance. It burns 1 inch per second. Fails about 5% of times over 10 yards.
object.name: Fuse (1 yard)

object.description: Used to sharpening blades.
object.name: Whetstone

object.description: Polearm with short spike on the top for Impale, an axe head to one side for Hack, and a hammer head on the other side for Pummel.
object.name: Pollaxe

object.description: A handgun with 2 barrels and 2 triggers. Comes with a device for reloading both barrels at once.
object.name: Double-barrelled Handgun

object.description: Can be loaded into Hand Mortar. Fuse must be lit before loading.
object.name: Incendiary (Ammunition)

object.description: A small vial of green dye. Enough to change colour of a single set of cloths.
object.name: Dye - Green

object.description: Plate body armour. Wearing any Plate imposes a  -10 Stealth Penalty.
object.name: Breastplate

object.description:
Pestle and mortar, small knives, pruning shears, and
gloves
object.name: Trade Tools - Herbalist

object.description: Book about religion. It is one of the most common types of books.
object.name: Book - Religion

object.description: Used to catch game.
object.name: Animal Trap

object.description: With haft made of living wood, can move much faster than other weapons of this size.
object.name: Wildwood

object.description: A very large and scary axe.
object.name: Slayer's Axe

object.description:
When making a Test to see if an opponent becomes entangled
in a weighted net, the net has a Strength of 55.
object.name: Weighted Net

object.description: A pebble that can b used as projectile for a sling. Can be sourced in a suitable location by passing an extended Easy (+40) Outdoor Survival Test or an extended Challenging (+0) Perception Test requiring a total of 5 SL.
object.name: Pebble

object.description: Can we used as Halberd with Melee - Polearm Skill. If used as an axe while loaded, any critical fumble will discharge the weapon into anyone unlucky enough to be standing directly behind the user.
object.name: Gun Halberd

object.description: Hook with some rope attached. Can be shot from Hand Mortar. May be used to attach a rope to a distant point, or snare an escaping enemy, in which case it inflicts one Entangled Condition on a successful hit.
object.name: Grapple

object.description:
Black lotus grows in Southland jungles. It is used to create deadly blade venom. Anyone who gets at least 1 Wound form a venom-covered blade take 2 Poisoned Conditions. Can be Resisted with a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test.
In Ulthuan it is Scarce rather than Exotic, and costs half of the usual price (10GC).
object.name: Black Lotus

object.description: Well made blade used for harvesting, or reaping. Can also be used as a hand weapon.
object.name: Sickle

object.description: The shutters protect flame from the wind and can be used to direct the light in a specific direction (90 deg arc) or darken it completely. Illuminates for 20 yards or 30 yards when directed by the shutters.
object.name: Storm Lantern

object.description: Lighter than usual similar Empire weapons, Eonir blades have better balance and are great for swift, precise strikes.
object.name: Eonir War Blade

object.description: Just a larger piece of wood. Players in wooded areas can take a Extended Challenging (+0) Outdoor Survival Test requiring a total of 7 SL to find one.
object.name: Club

object.description: Basically a metal spike on a stick. Not as agile as sword but good for piercing armor.
object.name: Military Pick

object.description: Is flat and heavy on one side for pummelling damage and has a spike on another for penetrating damage.
object.name: Warhammer

object.description: A hooked blade on a long shaft.
object.name: Bill

object.description: The arrowhead has extra hooks that cause deeper wounds.
object.name: Barbed Arrow

object.description: Contains enough for 12 horns, which each contain enough for 12 shots.
object.name: Keg of Blackpowder

object.description: Used mostly for advertising.
object.name: Placard

object.description: A comb.
object.name: Comb

object.description: A large round wooden shield designed to protect crossbowmen during reload. It costs 2 Actions to set up. After setting up, if the character stays 1 yard behind the Pavise, it has Shield 5 Quality against projectiles. In case of melee attack it provides Shield 5 protection only in the first turn of combat.
object.name: Pavise

object.description: Gauntlet with spikes. Can be part of a plate armor, in that case it does not add extra Encumbrance.
object.name: Spiked Gauntlet

object.description: Can we used as Axe with Melee - Basic Skill. If used as an axe while loaded, any critical fumble will discharge the weapon into the torso of the user.
object.name: Gun Axe

object.description: More explosive than normal powder. Any failed Test that includes either an 8 or 9 on either the 10s or units die counts as a Fumble when using this powder.
object.name: Aqshy-Infused Powder

object.description: A bar of soap.
object.name: Soap

object.description: Large size ogre club. This one is customised with rusty spikes sticking out of it. Usable only by large creatures.
object.name: Big Ogre Club (with Rusty Spikes)

object.description: A woollen doublet that is worn under armour. This armour uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Reinforced Soft Kit

object.description: Shot for Leadbelcher Gun.
object.name: Leadbelcher Shot

object.description: Close-fitting, sleeveless boiled leather jacket. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Leather Jerkin - v2

object.description: Chainmail body and arms armour. Wearing any Mail imposes a  -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Chainmail Coat - v2

object.description: Chainmail head armour. It has -10 Perception penalty. Wearing any Mail imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Chainmail Coif - v2

object.description: 1 yard long. A set of mirrors allowing the user to see from a point of view 1 yard above their had.
object.name: Periscope

object.description: Simple boiled leather leg protection. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Leather Leggings - v2

object.description: Chainmail leg armour. Wearing any Mail imposes a  -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Chainmail Chausses - v2

object.description: Leather jacket lined internally with small oblong steel plates riveted to the fabric. This armour uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Brigandine Jack

object.description: Close-fitting, sleeveless leather jacket lined internally with small oblong steel plates riveted to the fabric. This armour uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Brigandine Jerkin

object.description: "Average" size ogre club. This one is customised with rusty spikes sticking out of it. Usable only by large creatures.
object.name: Ogre Club (with Rusty Spikes)

object.description: Large size ore pistol. Uses the same shot and powder as typical blackpowder pistol. It is strong enough to serve as Hand Weapon but it will break on Fumbled attack. Usable only by large creatures.
object.name: Ogre Pistol

object.description: Ammunition for Ogre Harpoon Launcher.
object.name: Harpoon

object.description: A small vial of purple dye. Enough to change colour of a single set of cloths.
object.name: Dye - Purple

object.description: A cannon ball that can be shot from Leadbelcher Gun. The price includes 2/- worth of powder to fire a single shot. The ball itself can usually be recovered and re-used.
object.name: Leadbelcher Ball

object.description: A small vial of blue dye. Enough to change colour of a single set of cloths.
object.name: Dye - Blue

object.description: Large size ogre club. This one is customised with blades attached to it. Usable only by large creatures.
object.name: Big Ogre Club (with Scavenged Blades)

object.description: Boiled leather jacket protecting body and arms. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Leather Jack - v2

object.description: Elaborate wizard robes are extravagant and cumbersome costumes that often feature oversized accessories and yards of fabric woven with enchanted thread. These robes are not practical to wear and are intended to make a statement. They are easily recognisable as wizard attire and will draw attention to the wearer.
object.name: Elaborate Robes

object.description: Ogre throwing spear. Usable only by large creatures.
object.name: Great Throwing Spear

object.description: A massive slab of metal, hardwood, bone or leather, it protects the Ogre's belly, where most of their vital organs reside. They are uniquely suited to Ogre anatomy, and indeed even if scaled down, would be no good for other species.
object.name: Ogre Gutplate

object.description: "Average" size ogre club. This one is customised with metal plates around it. Usable only by large creatures.
object.name: Ogre Club (with Metal Plates)

object.description: "Average" size ogre club. This one is customised with blades attached to it. Usable only by large creatures.
object.name: Ogre Club (with Scavenged Blades)

object.description: Large size ogre club. This one is customised with metal plates around it. Usable only by large creatures.
object.name: Big Ogre Club (with Metal Plates)

object.description: Plate arms armour. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Bracers - v2

object.description: Plate helmet that provides extra neck protection. It reduces Critical Hit Damage to head area by 1. It imposes -20 to Perception. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Sallet

object.description: A small chunk of glass. When white light passes through it is split into multiple colours.
object.name: Prism

object.description: Plate legs armour. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Plate Leggings - v2

object.description: Practical wizard robes.These are simple and comfortable costumes that come at an affordable price. They have a plain appearance, making it possible for a wizard dressed in them to blend in unnoticed in various situations.
object.name: Practical Robes

object.description: The standard wizard robes are elaborate costumes that usually consist of thick coats or cloaks and unique headwear.
object.name: Standard Robes

object.description: A small magnet.
object.name: Magnet

object.description: A small vial of corrosive liquid.
object.name: Vial of Corrosive Liquid

object.description: A woollen doublet that is worn under armour. This armour uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Soft Kit

object.description: Plate helmet with designed to withstand more blows than other helmets. It imposes -20 to Perception. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Armet

object.description: Massive ogre ironfist. They are tightly attached to user's hand so that user cannot be disarmed. Usable only by large creatures.
object.name: Ironfist

object.description: Essentially a cannon, Leadbelcher Gun is the most advanced Ogre weapon. Breech loaded and fired by lighting a simple fuse. Usable only by large creatures.
object.name: Leadbelcher Gun

object.description: Ogre weapon. It is a massive spring-loaded metal jaws attached to a chain. Usable only by large creatures.
object.name: Chain Trap

object.description: Open plate head armour. It imposes -10 to Perception. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Open Helm - v2

object.description: Boiled leather head protection. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Leather Skullcap - v2

object.description: Chainmail body armour. Does not protect arms. Wearing any Mail imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Chainmail Shirt - v2

object.description: Plate helmet with conical visor. It provides 4 APs (instead of 3) against projectiles shot at the visor. It imposes -20 to Perception. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Bascinet

object.description: Ogre launcher that shoots a massive bolts attached to a rope. There is no mechanism to automatically pull back the rope. Can be used with either Ranged - Crossbow or Ranged - Entangling Skills without penalty. If the rope is removed from the bolt, the range increases to 60 but Entangle Quality is lost. Usable only by large creatures.
object.name: Harpoon Launcher

object.description: Plate body armour. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Breastplate - v2

object.description: Archetypal fully enclosed plate helm. It's considered old fashioned in Tilea and the Empire but still widely used in Bretonnia. It imposes -20 to Perception. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Great Helm

object.description: Small club made out of obsinite and lined with bronze. Price and availability assumes the weapon is being purchased in Lustria, for example Skeggi or Port Reaver. It is much more expensive and hard to get outside of Lustria.
object.name: Obsinite Club

object.description: Large maul made out of obsinite and lined with bronze. Price and availability assumes the weapon is being purchased in Lustria, for example Skeggi or Port Reaver. It is much more expensive and hard to get outside of Lustria.
object.name: Obsinite Spiked Maul

object.description: Used to shoot poisonous darts. Gains Dangerous Flaw when used without Ranged - blowpipe Skill. Price and availability assumes the weapon is being purchased in Lustria, for example Skeggi or Port Reaver. It is much more expensive and hard to get outside of Lustria.
object.name: Blowpipe

object.description: Blowpipe dart. Usually covered with poison. Price and availability assumes the weapon is being purchased in Lustria, for example Skeggi or Port Reaver. It is much more expensive and hard to get outside of Lustria.
object.name: Blowpipe Dart

object.description: Grassland herb available in autumn. When inhaled (infusion) the target has to pass Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or starts to mildly shake (-20 Dex). When drank (draught), the target receives 2 Poisoned Conditions, resisted with a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test.
object.name: Agurk

object.description: Coniferous forest herb available in summer and autumn. When applied daily to a dislocated or broken bone (as poultice) it halves the usual healing time.
object.name: Alfunas

object.description: Mixed forest herb available in spring and winter. Can be applied once a day to a Festering Wound as poultice. Each time, the target makes an Average (+20) Endurance Test. Reduce the duration of Festering Wound by 1 day for each SL.
object.name: Gesundheit

object.description: Found in Forest clearings and graveyards during autumn and winter. Smeared on the weapon (raw) causes 1 Poisoned Condition to creatures with Undead Trait unless they pass a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test. A poultice of Graveroot applied to Festering Wound caused by Undead with the Infected Trait adds +20 to all Tests against the Festering Wound. Can be applied once per day. When ingested as draught, it makes the body cold in touch for 1d10+2 hours.
object.name: Graveroot

object.description: Forest herb available during spring. 1d10 minutes after contact with its juice (raw), the affected area becomes itchy for 2d10 + 40 minutes causing -20 to all Tests. The target can make a Challenging (+0) WP Test to ignore the itching for 10 * (1 + SL) minutes, totally negating the penalty with 2 or more SLs. It can also be applied as poultice to speed up frostbite healing. One dose will heal 1d10 wounds lost to the effects of Exposure to cold weather. Can be repeated daily.
object.name: Juck

object.description: Hills herb available during spring. When eaten raw, each dose gives +10 to the next Casting Test. With each dose roll 1d10, if the number is lower or equal the number of doses already eaten  that day, the dose has no effect.
object.name: Mage-Leaf

object.description: Grassland herb available during spring. Infusion takes effect after 2d10 + 10 and puts the target to sleep. During first 4 hours chances of being woken by noise ale halved. Draught works the same but effect comes after 1d10 minutes and target is harder to wake up for 2 hours.
object.name: Schlafenkraut

object.description: Marsh herb available during autumn. Anyone who drinks its infusion, must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or suffer a -10 Int and -10 WP for 2d10 + 4 hours. A poultice can be used to remove a Bleeding Condition for a wound.
object.name: Slowmind

object.description: Marsh herb available during summer. Speeds up healing.
object.name: Sigmafoil

object.description: Hills herb available during spring. When ingested raw, it provides +10 to all Tests related to Packers Pox. As draguht, it reduces the duration of the Packers Pox by 1d10 days.
object.name: Speckled Rustwort

object.description: Forest herb available during summer. Infusion causes -10 penalty to all spellcasting Tests and +10 to all Tests to resist magic for (10 - T Bonus) hours. Draught has the same effect but for 1 hour only. However, the affected person will appear completely mundane to Second Sight.
object.name: Spellwort

object.description: Herb found in coniferous forest during autumn. Applied raw to a wound, on a successful Heal Test, it removes a Bleeding Condition. As poultice, it has similar effect but removes 1 extra Bleeding Condition for every SL of the Heal Test.
object.name: Spiderleaf

object.description: Herb found in mixed forests during summer. Poultice applied to a wound, sends the person into 24h deep sleep. The Endurance Test made to recover Wounds that day is Very Easy (+60). Can also be applied to weapons. When struck, the target must make a  Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or suffer a Fatigued Condition.
object.name: Tarrabeth

object.description: Herb found in forests during autumn. Eaten raw, it gives +20 bonus to Consume Alcohol Tests for the next 24 hours.
object.name: Trinkwort

object.description: Herb found in mixed forests during spring. Valerian infusion restores 1 Wound. The dose may be repeated once per day. Has no effect on Critical Wounds.
object.name: Valerian

object.description: Herb found on hills during spring. When ingested raw, the person is treated as resting. If the person rests during that time, the benefits of rest are doubled. After the dose wears off, it gives 1 Fatigued Condition for 1 hour.
object.name: Vanera

object.description: Grassland herb available in summer. Vigwort infusion gives +10 I for 1d10 +4 minutes. After is wears off, the character must make an Average (+20) Endurance Test or gain a Fatigued Condition for each level of failure.
object.name: Vigwort

object.description: Clear oily liquid. Each dose boosts T and Ag by +10 but lowers Int and WP by -10. It also removes all Fatigued Conditions and no new can be gained until the effect wears off. The effect lasts T Bonus hours.
object.name: Estalian Mosca

object.description: The drinker receives 3 Stunned Conditions, and cannot make Endurance Tests to remove them until the effects of the potion wear of. During that time, they also gain the Immunity to Psychology and Painless Traits. The effect lasts 2+d10 hours.
object.name: Potion of Resistance

object.description:
Has a Strength of 50. Each attempt to escape it inflicts 1 Wound,
regardless of the T Bonus or Armour.
object.name: Barbed Net

object.description: Drinker gains Flight Creature Trait for 20 Rounds minus Toughness Bonus.
object.name: Potion of Flight

object.description: Skaven Moulder clan weapon. Barbed prod is used primarily for herding Rat Ogres, Ignores all Armour.
object.name: Beast-Prod

object.description: Large shield designed to shield small-crewed weapons from enemy fire. It makes all ranged attacks targeting the crew Hard (-20).
object.name: Pavise - Skaven version

object.description: Skaven Pestilens clan weapon. All living creatures around this weapon suffer exposure to Corruption. 8 yards - Minor, 4 yards - Moderate, 2 yards - Major.
object.name: Plague Censer

object.description: Skaven Eshin clan weapon.
object.name: Punch Dagger

object.description: Skaven Eshin clan weapon. Provides +10 to all Climb Tests.
object.name: Rat Claws

object.description: Weapon designed to be held or attached to your tail. Requires being a Skaven and having Tail Fighting Talent.
object.name: Tail Weapon

object.description: Skaven Moulder clan weapon.
object.name: Things-Catcher

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. When the globe shatters it releases a poisonous cloud 3 yd in diameter and 3 yd high that lasts for  1d10-1 rounds. All creatures within the cloud have to pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test every round or suffer a +4 Damage hit that ignores AP and T Bonus.
object.name: Poisoned Wind Globe

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. When the globe shatters it releases a poisonous cloud 4.5 yd in diameter and 3.75 yd high that lasts for  1d10-1 rounds. All creatures within the cloud have to pass a Hard (-20) Endurance Test every round or suffer a +1d10 Damage hit that ignores AP.
object.name: Death Globe

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan handheld rocket launcher. It is very unreliable, in case of fumble roll on table on p. 34.
object.name: Doomrocket Launcher

object.description: Skaven Moulder clan weapon.
object.name: Electro-Whip

object.description: Skaven Eshin clan weapon. Can be set up to detonate for up to 10 rounds after it is dropped or thrown.
object.name: Infernal Bomb

object.description: Ammunition for Doomrocket Launcher.
object.name: Doomrocket

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan Poisoned Wind Globe launcher. Requires a team of 2 Skavens. The Enc value applies to main gunner. Has a min. range of 20.
object.name: Poisoned Wind Mortar

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan Poisoned Wind Globe launcher. Requires a team of 2 Skavens. The Enc value applies to main gunner.
object.name: Ratling Gun

object.description: Ammunition for Ratling Gun.
object.name: Ratling Gun Belt

object.description: Skaven Eshin clan weapon. Creates smoke in area of 2 yd radius for 1d10 rounds. It prevent all ranged attacks, magic missiles, and attacks that relay on sight.
object.name: Smoke Bomb

object.description: Skaven Eshin clan weapon.  It causes twice the normal number of Entangled Conditions.
object.name: Snare-Net

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. Requires a team of 2 Skavens. The Enc value applies to main gunner. Anyone hit by Warpfire Thrower must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain an Ablaze condition. Very unreliable, if the attack results in a Fumble, roll on the table on p. 36.
object.name: Warpfire Thrower

object.description: Ammunition for Warpfire Thrower.
object.name: Warpfire Fuel Vat

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. Requires a team of 2 Skavens. The Enc value is split between them. Mainly use to dig. It can cut a 5 ft diameter tunnel at a Movement rate of 2.
object.name: Warp-grinder

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. Usually requires a second Skaven to hold and stabilise the barrel. Can use regular blackpowder and shot but this reduces its Range to 72 and Damage to +5. In case of a Fumble, roll 1d10. On 1, the riffle explodes in a Blast 1 explosion dealing the same Damage as a successful shot. On 2-10 roll on the table in WFRP on page 160.

object.name: Liber Bubonicus

object.description: Skaven ointment. Instantly cures 1d10 + 1 Wounds but each use counts as Moderate Exposure to Corruption.
object.name: Skalm

object.description: Skaven drink. For effect roll 1d100 on table on p. 40. The effect lasts for 2d10 - T Bonus (min. 1). No-Skaven must make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test when the effects ends. If they fail, they gain 1 Poisoned and 1 Bleeding Condition. In case of Astounding Failure, they also suffer 1 Ablaze Condition.
object.name: Skavenbrew

object.description: Pestilens clan item. Contains a spell that can be cast once without a Casting Test. There is no chance of a miscast or a critical.

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan item. When attached to a ranged weapon, it negates difficulty penalties for shooting at a target in cover.
object.name: Warlock Optics

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan item. When used with a Warp-blade, the blade gains +1 Damage.
object.name: Warp Energy Condenser

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. The blade is surrounded by tangle of wires that feed the blade with Warp energy.
object.name: Warp-Blade Halberd

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. The blade is surrounded by tangle of wires that feed the blade with Warp energy.
object.name: Warp-Blade Hand Weapon

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan item. When equipped, improves Warp Lightning Spell. The caster can reverse the dice used for the Casting Test. In case of miscast, the caster must pass a Hard (-30) Dexterity Test to disable the device or it explodes dealing 3d10 Damage to everyone within 3 yds and counts as  Moderate Exposure to Corruption to everyone within 5 yds.
object.name: Warp-Power Accumulator

object.description: Coins with addition of Warpstone. The Skaven use is at fuel and currency.
object.name: Warpstone Token

object.description: Skaven poison. Anyone damaged by a weapon covered with it, must make a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test or suffer 3 more Wounds that ignore AP and T Bonus.
object.name: Dark Kiss

object.description: Skaven poison. Anyone damaged by a weapon covered with it, must make a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or roll on the Stinking Drunk table (WFRP, p. 121). While under the influence, every time they are asked a question, they must pass a Difficult (-10) Willpower Test or they answer truthfully.
object.name: Foolmaker

object.description: Skaven Warpstone powder. When consumed, it grants (one time) +1 SL to Channelling Test. In case of a miscast, the caster has to add +10 to any roll on the miscast.
object.name: Warpstone Snuff

object.description: Allows any Skaven who wears it to reroll a single Test once every 13 hours.
object.name: Warpstone Charm

object.description: Trap made of semi-circular jaws that spring when a victim steps on it. The hit is determined by performing opposed Perception Test (vs Set Trap Test). Does SB+4 Dmg (Leg hits only) and has Fast and Penetrating Qualities. If the trap is chained, the victim is held in place until freed, otherwise it causes 1 Entangled Condition. Can opened on a successful Difficult (-10) Strength Test.
object.name: Man-trap

object.description: Full of shrapnel, creates massive and deadly explosion. Often used in tunnel fighting.
object.name: Cinderblast Bomb - v2

object.description: Non-magical weapons covered with Ghostsmear can hit creatures with Ethereal Trait. The effects lasts for 1 hour but stops immediately if the weapon is used to wound a living creature. Can only be made by  priests of Morr and requires 3 GC worth of ingredients. Can be stored for 1 year.
object.name: Ghostsmear

object.description: When consumed grants powerful visions of past and future. To determine the effects, Roll 1d100 on table on p. 31.
object.name: Purple Cap Mushrooms

object.description: Chainmail leg armour. Wearer can only whisper.
object.name: Quietened Chainmail Chausses

object.description: Chainmail body and arms armour. Wearer can only whisper.
object.name: Quietened Chainmail Coat

object.description: Chainmail head armour. It has -10 Perception penalty. Wearer can only whisper.
object.name: Quietened Chainmail Coif

object.description: Chainmail leg armour. Wearer can only whisper. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Quietened Chainmail Chausses - v2

object.description: Chainmail body and arms armour. Wearer can only whisper. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Quietened Chainmail Coat - v2

object.description: Chainmail head armour. It has -10 Perception penalty. Wearer can only whisper. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Quietened Chainmail Coif - v2

object.description: Ignores any AP provided by armour that has the Weakpoints Flaw.
object.name: Throatseeker's Blade

object.description: A five-volume exploration of the nature of Chaos written by Richter Kless.
object.name: Liber Chaotica

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 2 hours. Drinker suffers -2 SL to all Fel and Dex based Tests. They also gain Distracting Creature Trait. Lasts 1d10 hours.
object.name: Boar's Musk

object.description: Potion. Onset time: immediate. Drinker gains + 2 SL to all Channelling Tests. Lasts 1d10 minutes.
object.name: Channelpath Potion

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 1d10 minutes. Drinker passes all Consume Alcohol Tests. Lasts 1d10 hours.
object.name: Debauchs Friend

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 1 round. Reduce spell and ritual CNs by half. Lasts 2d10 rounds.
object.name: Draught of Power

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 15 minutes. Cases hair growth to applied body area. One dose is enough to cover whole human scalp. Lasts until hair naturally falls out.
object.name: Hair Tonic

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 1 hour. Gives the drinker +1 SL to all Int and WP based Tests and immunity to Fatigued Condition. Lasts 3d10 hours, after which the drinker receives 3 Fatigued Conditions.
object.name: Lucidity Tonic

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 1 hour. Drinker gains +1 SL to all Fel based Tests involving characters that are ordinarily attracted to the drinker's species and gender. Lasts 3d10 hours.
object.name: Nectar of Beauty

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 1 hour. Drinker has to pass a Hard (-20) Cool Test every time they want to lie. Lasts 3d10 hours.
object.name: Nectar of Veracity

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 1 round. Drinker gains Regenerate Creature Trait. Lasts 3d10 minutes.
object.name: Nectar of Vitality

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 1d10 rounds. Drinker recovers 3 times T Bonus Wounds. It removes any Bleeding or Fatigued Conditions. Removes any diseases on a successful Average (+20) Endurance Test. Can remove Critical Injury (see table on p. 163).
object.name: Panacea Universalis

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 1d10 rounds. Drinker gains +2 to S and T Bonus. They also gain +2 SL to any S or T based Test. Lasts 1d10 hours.
object.name: Potency Draught

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 1d10 rounds. Drinker gains Flight (20) Creature Trait. Lasts 1d10 minutes.
object.name: Potion of Flight - v2

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 1 round. Drinker can make an Easy (+40) Augury using their Int if they do not have the Augury Skill.
object.name: Potion of Fortune

object.description: Potion. Onset time: 1d10 rounds. Drinker becomes invisible. Creatures with Second Sight Talent may detect the drinker but suffer a -2 SL penalty on their Perception Test. Lasts 1d10 minutes.
object.name: Potion of Invisibility

object.description: Special wine that can be used with Augury Skill. After drinking you must pass a Challenging (+0) Consume Alcohol Test. If you fail the Test the following apply. Gain Sixth Sense and Magical Sense Talents and receive a +2 SL bonus to any Intuition based Tests. You can chose to gain an extra Fortune point or make a roll on the Augury Table using your Intelligence rather than the Augury Skill. Consuming the wine, causes Minor Corruption Exposure. You must also pass an Average (+20) Cool Test or will "hear the call". If you hear the call more times than you WP Bonus you abandon your life and travel to the Grey Mountain vineyards.
object.name: Dreamwine

object.description: Gromil Open Helm.
object.name: Gromril Helm

object.description: Gromil Open Helm. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
object.name: Gromril Helm  - v2

object.description: A Dagger that is Magical.
object.name: Magical Dagger

object.description: An Arabyan spyglass. Can see through any obfuscation, including magical.
object.name: Enchanted Spyglass

object.description: Prevent the wearer from suffering any natural temperature extremes (both hot and cold).
object.name: Jarl Fur Jacket

object.description: Device that can track Morrslieb's movements.
object.name: Roth's Moondial

object.description: The wearer gains Flight (45) and Magic Resistance (2) Creature Traits.
object.name: Cloak of Feathers

object.description: Every time a creature is wounded by a it, they must take a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test or suffer a Poisoned Condition.
object.name: Plaguesword

object.description:
Made out of Weirdroot. Gives +10 bonus to WP Tests and -10 to
Ag, I, and Int Tests. Effect lasts 1d10 x 10 minutes.
object.name: Ameliorative Elixir

object.description: Gives +20 to Int and Endurance Tests. Effect lasts 1d10 hours. After than gain 1 Fatigued Condition that lasts for at least a day.
object.name: Focusing Philtre

object.description: Drinker gains receives the benefit of the Attractive Talent for 1d10 hours. After it wears off, they suffer -20 to all Fel tests for 1d10 days.
object.name: Katya's Cordial

object.description: Gain +1 Fortune point for 1d10 minutes. If you spend that point roll d100, if you roll a double, regain it. When the effect wears off, you lose all your Fortune points and gain 1 Fatigued Condition that lasts for at least a day.
object.name: Liquor of Luck

object.description: To drink it, you must first pass an Average (+20) Cool Test. If successful, gain 1 Fatigued Condition which can only be removed after a good night's rest. There are no other effects.
object.name: The Marvellous Medicinal Mixture

object.description: While under its effect, you cannot gain Surprised Condition. Lasts 1d10 hours. After it wears off, gain 1 Fatigued Condition that lasts at least a day.
object.name: Reactionary Restorative

object.description: Roll 1d10. Depending on result gain 1 of the following Talents for: 1d10 minutes: 1-2: Acute Sense - Sight, 3-4: Holy Visions, 5-6: Magical Sense, 7-8: Second Sight, 9-10: all of the above.
object.name: Tonic of Sight Beyond Sight

object.description: Antidote. Forms: potion. Does nothing on its own. When combined with a poison, it becomes antidote to that exact poison.
object.name: Bezoar Solvent

object.description: Concoction. Forms: raw, potion. Grants Painless Creature Trait for 1 hour.
object.name: Bloodblind

object.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. Grants Breath +10 (Fire) Creature Trait for 1 time use. Immediately after breathing fire, the user must pass a a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or gain 1 Ablaze Condition.
object.name: Carroburg Fire

object.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. Grants Cold-blooded Creature Trait. The drinker can reverse any failed Willpower based Tests. If they gain Surprised Condition, it is not lost  the first time it should be.
object.name: Clearmind

object.description: Poison. Forms: potion, unguent, raw. If a weapon covered with it inflicts at least 1 Wound, it inflicts additional 1d10 Wounds. If consumed in any form, one has to pass a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or suffer an immediate Critical Hit to the torso.
object.name: Flesh Blister

object.description: Concoction. Forms: unguent. Grants 4 AP against all fire damage and immunity to the Ablaze Condition. The user also suffer -20 to Ag and I. Effect lasts 1 hour.
object.name: Forge Shield

object.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. Can be used on a corpse not older than 1 day. The corpse can be asked 3 questions. If it is asked a fourth question, it will rise as a Thing from the Dead Wood.
object.name: Last Gasp

object.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. When poured out, it immediately starts to burn on any surface. If used as weapon, it can be treated as Incendiary bomb. Any Ablaze Condition gained from it cannot be put out for 3 rounds.
object.name: Liquid Fire

object.description: Poison. Forms: potion. Very difficult to detect, any attempt suffers a -40 penalty. When ingested, the target must pass s a Hard (-20) Endurance Test. If they fail, they feel tired a little earlier than usual. After they go to sleep, they must attempt another Hard (-20) Endurance Test. If they fail that one as well, they die in their sleep from seemingly natural causes.
object.name: Longsleep

object.description: Antidote. Forms: potion. Within 1 minute after drinking, the target becomes sober. The drinker becomes Fatigued for number of hours equal to 10 minus their Toughness Bonus.
object.name: Laurek's Cure

object.description: Concoction. Forms: potion, unguent, raw. Grants Frenzy for 1d10 Rounds.
object.name: Preyton's Fury

object.description: Concoction. Forms: potion, unguent. Creates a magical fire. When used as incendiary bomb, attacks count as Magical. Unguent can be smeared on the weapon and set alight for 1d10 Rounds. During that time the weapon inflicts a single Ablaze Condition with each strike and counts as Magical.
object.name: Razorburn

object.description: Concoction. Forms: potion, unguent. Imbiber must pass a  Consume Alcohol Test. If the succeed they can spend a Fortune Point within the next hour to reverse the dice of any failed Test.
object.name: Seer Snake Liquor

object.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. The drinker must take a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test. If they fail, they gain 2 Poisoned Conditions. If they pass, they gain Corrosive Blood Creature Trait for 3 + SL Rounds.
object.name: Spite

object.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. Drinker becomes immune to all poisons for 1 hour.
object.name: Stag's Ward

object.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. The imbiber gains 3 Poisoned Conditions (cannot be resisted), recovers T Bonus of Wounds, and gains Regenerate Creature Trait. Regenerate Creature Trait lasts for as long as the last Poisoned Condition.
object.name: Tide Blood

object.description: Concoction. Forms: unguent. When applied, covered body parts change colour to match the environment. Gives +40 to Stealth Tests relying on sight.
object.name: Treemeld

object.description:
Concoction. Forms: potion, raw. Extremally corrosive. If used as a weapon, causes +9 Damage and has Penetrating Quality and
Dangerous Flaw.
object.name: Troll Acid

object.description:
Antidote. Forms: potion, unguent. Grants +40 bonus to resist
the effects of any poison.
object.name: Two-Headed Tincture

object.description: Concoction. Forms: potion, unguent. Used to treat wounds. When applied as unguent, it removes all Bleeding Conditions without a Heal Test. In potion form, it removes 1 Bleeding Condition at the end of each Round for 1 hour. In addition, vampires do not heal Wounds if they drink imbiber's blood.
object.name: Veinpowder

object.description: Poison. Forms: potion. Causes unusual fatigue for 6 hours. Any moderate physical task inflicts a Fatigued Condition. Anything that would normally result in Fatigued Condition, inflicts 2 Conditions instead. At the end of each hour, the victim may attempt a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test to shake off this effect. If they pass they no longer gain Fatigued Conditions due to Wheeze.
object.name: Wheeze

object.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. Grants Magic Resistance 3 Creature Trait for 1 hour. If used multiple times, each dose increases resistance by 1 and duration by 1 hour. For each dose consumed after the first, the imbiber must make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test. If they fail, they  receive 1 Poisoned Condition each Round for 10 Rounds. All Poisoned Conditions are removed after 10 Rounds.
object.name: Witchbane

object.description: Poison. Forms: unguent. Whenever a weapon covered with it causes at least 1 Wound, the victim must pass Endurance Test or take an additional 5 Wounds that ignore Toughness and AP. It evaporates from weapons within 2+1d10 Rounds.
object.name: Wyvern's Kiss

object.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. Ignores Metal Armour. If it causes at least 1 Wound, the victim has to pass an Average (+20) Endurance Test or gain a Stunned Condition.
object.name: Warp Blade

object.description: A Dagger that is Magical.
object.name: Magical Dagger - copy

object.description: Dwarf dagger made out of Great Eagle Talon.
object.name: Eagle Shank

object.description: Every time this dagger inflicts at least 1 Wound, the target immediately take a Poisoned Condition resisted with a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test. When the poison runs dry, Fell Dagger shatters.
object.name: Fell Dagger

object.description: Sword with hilt made of Great Stag Antler. Even though it can corrode, crack or bend, it will never break in battle.
object.name: Antler Hilted Blade

object.description: Sword with hilt made of Great Stag Antler. Even though it can corrode, crack or bend, it will never break in battle. Inflicts Bleeding Condition on both its wielder and its victim every time it is used to inflict a Critical Wound.
object.name: Antler Hilted Blade - Bleeding

object.description: Plate body armour. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. Uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III. Lighter than usual because it is made out of Leviathan Scale or Carapace.
object.name: Leviathan Breastplate

object.description: Plate legs armour. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. Uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III. Lighter than usual because it is made out of Leviathan Scale or Carapace.
object.name: Leviathan Plate Leggings

object.description: Open plate head armour. It imposes -10 to Perception. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. Uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III. Lighter than usual because it is made out of Leviathan Scale or Carapace.
object.name: Leviathan Helm

object.description: Made with Griffon Feathers by the master-fletchers of Ostermark.
object.name: Griffon Fletching Arrow

object.description: Made with Griffon Feathers by the master-fletchers of Ostermark.
object.name: Griffon Fletching Bolt

object.description: Can be used to cover up to 6 bolts of arrows to give them Penetrating Quality. Once covered, they have to be used within 1 day. After 1 day they become useless.
object.name: Tregara Sap

object.description:
Any attack that inflict at least 1 Wound, also inflicts one
Bleeding Condition.
object.name: Shard Tips Bolt

object.description:
Any attack that inflict at least 1 Wound, also inflicts one
Bleeding Condition.
object.name: Shard Tips Arrow

object.description: Is flat and heavy on one side for pummelling damage and has a spike on another for penetrating damage. After killing an opponent, every living creature within 10 yards, other than the wielder of the hammer, must make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain a Deafened Condition and suffer 1d10 Wounds which bypass AP.
object.name: Bone Smasher

object.description: A regular sword. Well balanced. Contains Siren hair in the hilt. The wielder cannot speak, scream etc.
object.name: Silence Sword

object.description: Deadlier version of a knife. Contains Siren hair in the hilt. The wielder cannot speak, scream etc.
object.name: Silence Dagger

object.description: Bearer can see Undead creature as they looked in life. This removes the Fear Trait of any Undead, unless whatever creature they were in life would naturally have this Trait.
object.name: Wightseer

object.description: For the purposes of Opposed Strength Tests, the wearer counts their size as one step larger than it actually is.
object.name: Throttler's Gloves

object.description: This Cloak grant Fear 2 in Wolves, Lions, Goats, and Chimeras.
object.name: Wulfshawl

object.description: A cup made out of a skull of Undead. By drinking from the cup, the imbiber can see and talk to ghosts an spirits. The effects lasts 1 minute but may be extended by taking more sips.
object.name: The Last Toast

object.description: Magical ruby can absorb any blood. When it does, it grants Ward 9+ Creature Trait for 1d10 Rounds. If the wearer gains a Bleeding Condition they must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or the stone will attach itself to the wound. While it is attached, the Bleeding Condition cannot be removed. The stone can be removed by with a successful Average (+20) Strength Test.
object.name: The Thristy Stone

object.description: Magic workshop with variety of ingredients and tools required for magic research.
object.name: Workshop - Magic

object.description: Library filled with books about magic.
object.name: Library - Magic

object.description: Flask with enchanted miasma. When opened, it releases cloud of gas. Everyone in the room suffer Blinded Condition. If they fail an Average (+20) Endurance Test, they also suffer from the Convulsions symptom for d10 turns.
object.name: Enchanted Miasma

object.description: Vial of Schlaff poison. Anyone affected by it shows the following symptoms: slurred speech, apathy, sleepiness, and heave red-rimmed eyes. A Character with medical knowledge may attempt a Hard (-20) Lore - Medicine Test to identify the cause of these symptoms. If a character consumes it, they need to pass a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or gain one Fatigued Condition for each dose consumed.
object.name: Vial of Schlaf

object.description:
A mix of Black Lotus, Warpstone, and other unpleasant materials. When consumed, it puts the person in a blissful trance that can last for days. The person must pass a Very Hard (-30) Toughness Test, gaining the Unconscious Condition for a number of hours equal to twice -SL, to a minimum of 4.
Each dose is a Minor Corruption, but if the slumber lasts more than 8 hours it's a Moderate Corruption. After walking up, the person must pass a Hard (-20) Toughness Test or gain a Fatigued Condition that lasts 3 days or until another dose is taken.
object.name: Skitter

object.description: Military flail with a hollow head filled with burning coals. Anyone hit by it gets SL Ablaze Conditions.
object.name: Censer-Flail

object.description: Enchanted bullets and powder. The bullets ignore all magical armour. The victim suffers -8 SL to casting spells as long as the bullet is in their body. To remove the bullet, someone with Surgery Talent must pass Extended Challenging (+0) Heal Test that requires 8 SL. Each Test requires half an hour.
object.name: Enchanted Bullet and Powder

object.description: Bangle or pendant made out of bones, teeth or similar. Used by Orc and Goblin shamans. Allows shaman to reroll 1 Casting Test.
object.name: Dangly Wotnotz

object.description: Shaman who has it may reroll any Melee Tests made to attack an opponent.
object.name: Effigy of Gork

object.description: Shaman who has it may reroll any Dodge Tests or Melee Tests made to oppose an attack.
object.name: Effigy of Mork

object.description: Gives the Shaman Magic Resistance 2 Talent. Every time the bearer is targeted by a spell they must roll 1d100. On 01 they suffer 1d10 Wounds that ignore TB and Armour and gain Prone Condition.
object.name: Glowy Green Amulet

object.description: While holding the staff, the Shaman is isolated from other Orcs and Goblins. They suffer -2SL to Channelling and Casting Tests. They ignore presence of Orcs, Hobgoblins, and Goblins when rolling on the Waaagh! Miscast Table.
object.name: Copper Staf

object.description: Roll 1d10 for any given staff. The Shaman always counts as being within Willpower Bonus yards of that many Orcs when Channelling, Casting, or rolling on the Waaagh! Miscast Table.
object.name: Shaman Staff

object.description: The mushroom sprout from the bodies of infested Night Goblin Shamans. When eaten, for the next 2d10 Rounds, the Shaman counts as being within Willpower Bonus yards of 2d10 Orcs when Channelling, Casting, or rolling on the Waaagh! Miscast Table.
object.name: Shaman Shrooms

object.description: Highest quality Dwarf Plate Armour.
object.name: Gromril Breastplate

object.description: Highest quality Dwarf Plate Armour. Wearer suffers -10% to Perception.
object.name: Gromril Open Helm

object.description: Highest quality Dwarf Plate Armour.
object.name: Gromril Bracers

object.description: Highest quality Dwarf Plate Armour. Wearer suffers -10 to Stealth.
object.name: Gromril Leggings

object.description: Highest quality Dwarf Plate Armour. Wearer suffers -20% to Perception.
object.name: Gromril Gromril Helm - v3

object.description: Dwarf chainmail leg armour. Wearing any Mail imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty.
object.name: Mail Skirt

object.description:
Open plate head armour topped with candle sockets. It imposes -10 to Perception. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty.
Advanced versions have been adapted to accommodate a directional Storm Lantern.
object.name: Miner's Open Helm

object.description: Improved version of a regular axe. Well balanced and good against armour.
object.name: Dwarf Axe

object.description: Improved version of a regular warhammer. Well balanced and capable of pummeling damage.
object.name: Dwarf Warhammer

object.description: Axes attached to chains used by Doomseekers of Grimnir.
object.name: Whirling blades of death

object.description: Dwarf version of a two-handed battle axe.
object.name: Dwarf Greataxe

object.description: Dwarven, large two-handed battle hammer.
object.name: Dwarf Greathammer

object.description: Large dwarven pick. Often sold with a handful of candles, which can be lashed to the weapon as an improvised light source in desperate circumstances.
object.name: Dwarf Pick

object.description: Highly advanced dwarven drilling equipment.
object.name: Steam Drill

object.description: Highly advanced, unique dwarven axe that can be use to trap opponents weapon.
object.name: Cog Axe

object.description: Highly advanced dwarven contraption. Can be used to do both massive damage and defend against incoming attacks.
object.name: Steam Gauntlet

object.description: Dwarven made, medium range, two-handed firearm made out of metal barrel mounted on a wooden stock. More reliable than regular handgun, misfires only on a roll of 100.
object.name: Dwarf Handgun - v2

object.description: Dwarven made, compact version of a handgun that can be used with one hand and reloaded more easily. More reliable than regular pistol, misfires only on a roll of 100.
object.name: Dwarf Pistol - v2

object.description: Built by best dwarven craftsman, more deadly than  most regular crossbow.
object.name: Dwarf Crossbow - v2

object.description: Dwarven drakefire gun,  inflicts the Ablaze Condition on affected targets
object.name: Drakegun

object.description: Alternative ammunition for Dakegun. With this ammunition, Drakegun loses Penetrating Quality and Reload 4 becomes Reload 6.
object.name: Trollhammer Torpedo

object.description: Dwarven made, multi-barrel canon capable of 3 shots without reloading.
object.name: Repeating Dwarf Handgun

object.description: Very rare and powerful weapon. Shoots incendiary projectiles that can set enemies ablaze. Inflicts the Ablaze Condition on affected targets.
object.name: Drakefire Pistol - v2

object.description: Dwarven double-barreled shotgun.
object.name: Grudge-raker

object.description: Dwarven explosive used in mining. Inflicts the Ablaze Condition on affected targets.
object.name: Blasting Charge

object.description: Full of shrapnel, creates massive and deadly explosion. Often used in tunnel fighting.
object.name: Cinderblast Bomb - v3

object.description: Dwarven throwing axes are particularly effective against armour.
object.name: Dwarf Throwing Axe

object.description: used to hold multiple candles. Sold with a dozen of candles. Provides light within 15 yards when lit.
object.name: Candelabra

object.description: Large source of light. Provides light within 40 yards when lit.
object.name: Brazier

object.description: Dwarven battle standard.
object.name: Battle Standard

object.description: Thin, flexible plates are used by Runescribes to inscribe a semi-permanent record.
object.name: Metal Foil Sheets

object.description: Stone tables with grudges inscribed on them.
object.name: Reckoners Log

object.description: Includes pots, buckets, kettles, bottles, etc.
object.name: Trade Tools - Brewer

object.description: Includes masonry hammer, chisels, pick, spikes, steel tongs, etc.
object.name: Trade Tools - Mason

object.description: Used  for inscribing records that withstand the passage of time.
object.name: Stone Tablet

object.description: Brewer workshops usually have mills, tanks, kegs, and bottling lines.
object.name: Workshop - Brewer

object.description: Workshop with tools required for most ambitious masonry projects.
object.name: Workshop - Mason

object.description: Platform used by some of the Dwarf lords to get a height advantage in battle. Requires 2 bearers to carry the platform.
object.name: Shield Platform

object.description: Piece of a Dwarf s mountain home carried into battle with them. It is a carved rock inscribed with runes. In combat, character can use Move action to place and stand upon an Oathstone. When standing on it, they: gain +20 to any Tests to resist forced movement, including Tests to resist gaining the Broken Condition; enemies do not gain bonus attack modifiers for outnumbering you in melee, or for attacking you in the side or rear; suffer -20 penalty on all Dodge Skill Tests.
object.name: Oathstone

object.description: Legendary anvil required to craft the most powerful runes. It is also required to strike Doom Runes. Provides +20 all Runesmithing Extended Tests. Any Dwarf within 2 yards of an Anvil of Doom gains +20 on Tests to dispel magic with Magic Resistance.
object.name: Anvil of Doom

object.description: Magical amulet that grants Ward 1 worn by priests of Taal.
object.name: Amber Periapt

object.description: Herb used to distract tracking dogs. Dogs within 5 yards of the herb have to pass an Average (+20) Willpower Test. If they fail, they investigate the bag for 1d10 rounds before resuming tracking. On Astounding Failure (-6 SL or worse) they completely lose the trail.
object.name: Bag of Tarrabeth Seed

object.description: Darkens equipment and skin to improve stealth in darkness. Anyone trying to spot/identify user receives -1 SL to sight-based Perception Tests.
object.name: Bag of Soot

object.description: Creates 2-yard hazardous area that damages and slows movement. Requires multiple caltrops and 1 Action to deploy. Entering the area requires Hard (-20) Athletics Test. If the character is walking with awareness the Test becomes Average (+20). On Fail: Random leg takes 1d10 damage + Surprised condition.
object.name: Caltrops (set of 12)

object.description: Boot attachments that affect climbing and movement. Two are required to be effective. +2 SL climbing rock/wood, +1 SL climbing rope. All non-climbing actions: -1 SL Athletics/Agility, -2 SL Stealth, -2 SL other movement Tests.
object.name: Crampon (set of 2)

object.description: Tool for cutting glass panels. Requires Average (+20) Art (Engraving) Test to create an opening. If the result of the Test is less than 1 SL, see table on page 33 in Deft Steps Light Fingers.
object.name: Glass Cutter

object.description: A device with angled mirrors that allows sight around corners or over obstacles. Enables sight-based Perception Tests while remaining in cover.
object.name: Periscope

object.description: This throwable device provides concealment by creating a thick cloud of smoke, useful for escaping or obscuring vision. When thrown, creates a 10-yard diameter smoke cloud lasting 2d10 Rounds (doubled in enclosed spaces). Vision limited to 1 yard inside the cloud. Characters in the cloud must test for Suffocation.
object.name: Smoke Bomb

object.description: This specialised breaking tool lets you bypass locks or bolts without picking the lock mechanism. Requires Hard (-20) Sleight of Hand Test to use. If the result of the Test is less than 1 SL, see table on page 33 in Deft Steps Light Fingers.
object.name: Steel Mummit

object.description: Extendable pole reaching up to 12 feet (4 yards). Allows Dexterity Tests to manipulate distant objects with -2 SL penalty.
object.name: Telescopic Stick

object.description: Clothing that lets you blend in better. +2 SL to any Stealth Tests that are made in the appropriate terrain.
object.name: Hunters Garb

object.description:
Elf-made Dragon breasplate. Wearing any Plate imposes a  -10 Stealth Penalty.
Provides various protections against fire. Detailed rules on p. 35 of High Elf Player's Guide.
object.name: Dragon Breastplate

object.description: Elf-made Dragon open helm. It imposes -10 to Perception. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. Provides various protections against fire. Detailed rules on p. 35 of High Elf Player's Guide.
object.name: Dragon Open Helm

object.description:
Elf-made Dragon braces. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty.
Provide various protections against fire. Detailed rules on p. 35 of High Elf Player's Guide.
object.name: Dragon Bracers

object.description: Dragon plate legs armour. It imposes -10 to Stealth. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty (in addition to -10 caused by this item). Provide various protections against fire. Detailed rules on p. 35 of High Elf Player's Guide.
object.name: Dragon Plate Leggings

object.description: Elf-made Dragon closed helm. It imposes -20 to Perception. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. Provides various protections against fire. Detailed rules on p. 35 of High Elf Player's Guide.
object.name: Dragon Helm

object.description: Cloak made of White Lion pelt. White Lions are native to northernmost High Elf kingdoms, particularly Chrace.
object.name: White Lion Hide Cloak

object.description: Elf-made Ithilmar breasplate. Wearing any Plate imposes a  -10 Stealth Penalty.
object.name: Ithilmar Breastplate

object.description: Elf-made Ithilmar open helm. It imposes -10 to Perception. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. +1 Enc when not worn.
object.name: Ithilmar Open Helm

object.description: Elf-made Ithilmar braces. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty.
object.name: Ithilmar Bracers

object.description: Ithilmar plate legs armour. It imposes -10 to Stealth. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty (in addition to -10 caused by this item).
object.name: Ithilmar Plate Leggings

object.description: Elf-made Ithilmar closed helm. It imposes -20 to Perception. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. +1 Enc when not worn.
object.name: Ithilmar Helm

object.description: Elf-made Ithiltaen closed helm. It imposes -20 to Perception. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. +1 Enc when not worn.
object.name: Ithiltaen Helm

object.description: Sword made by High Elves. Well balanced. Common in Ulthuan but not outside of it.
object.name: High Elf Sword

object.description: Dagger made by High Elves. Common in Ulthuan but not outside of it.
object.name: High Elf Dagger

object.description: Shield made by High Elves. Common in Ulthuan but not outside of it.
object.name: High Elf Shield

object.description: Lance my by High Elves. Rare in Ulthuan, even more rare outside of it. If used by attacker without Charging, it count as Improvised Weapon (SB+1 Damage, Undamaging).
object.name: High Elf Lance

object.description: Halberd made by High Elves. Common in Ulthuan but not outside of it.
object.name: High Elf Halberd

object.description: Spear made by High Elves. Common in Ulthuan but not outside of it.
object.name: High Elf Spear

object.description: Gear Axe made by High Elves. Well balanced. Scarce in Ulthuan, even more rare outside of it.
object.name: High Elf Great Axe

object.description: This Elven blade is perfectly balanced and almost as long as an Elf is tall. It has various ornate patterns on blade and hilt, each is a unique work of art. The blade itself is not magical even though it requires magic to craft it. Required for sword-dancing techniques used by Swordmasters of Hoeth.
object.name: Greatsword of Hoeth

object.description: Dried halm emits pungent smell and bright light when burned. A Dragon that inhales the fumes loses 1 Fatigued Condition. Any awakened Dragon becomes immediately aware of burning Heartleaf. Dragons with history of cooperation with Elves may respond positively if treated respectfully and approached for serious reasons. Wild or hostile Dragons are unlikely to be friendly if attracted by Heartleaf.
object.name: Heartleaf

object.description:
Elvish wine made from narinocha pods, creating relaxation and vivid visions. Drinker must make a Challenging (+0) Consume Alcohol Test. Elves who fail roll on this special Stinking Drunk table:
1-2: Reassuring Mirage - Gain Yenlui (Light). -1 SL to Perception Tests until sober.
3-4: Disquieting Illusion - Gain Yenlui (Dark). -1 SL to Perception Tests until sober.
5-6: Kaleidoscopic Confusion - -4 SL to Perception Tests until sober.
7-8: Vision of the Annuliis - Gain Yenlui (Balanced).
9: Dream of Bucolic Avelorn - Gain Yenlui (Dark). -2 SL to Perception Tests until sober.
10: Nightmare of Mirai - Gain Yenlui (Dark). -2 SL to Perception Tests until sober.
object.name: Narinocha Wine

object.description: Health tonic that fortifies constitution when consumed regularly. A vial contains ten doses. One dose mixed with spring water creates a refreshing drink. Character who drinks regularly, receives +20 bonus to Tests resisting disease contraction.
object.name: Sunroot Extract, vial

object.description: Pale green liquid consumed by Elves to calm desires. Each vial contains one dose. Effects last 12 hours after drinking: prevents Frenzy, balances Yenlui, removes Dream/Obsession bonuses and penalties, allows rerolls on failed Cool Tests against Fear/Terror, and forces the drinker to ignore Prejudice, Animosity, or Hatred.
object.name: Viridescent Palliative

object.description: Device of interlocking brass discs and crystal lenses made by White Tower of Hoeth mages. User can discern relative concentrations of Winds of Magic in an area with a Challenging (+0) Lore (Magic) Test. Can also point to nearest concentration of a specific Wind with a Hard (-20) Lore (Magic) Test.
object.name: Aethyrolabe

object.description: Feather plucked from a Flamespyre Phoenix burns brightly for about a year. Casts light with the same intensity as a lantern and can set things ablaze as effectively as a torch.
object.name: Flamespyre Phoenix Feather

object.description: Feather plucked from a Frostheart Phoenix remains freezing cold for about a year. Casts dim, cold light providing illumination equivalent to a candle. Radiates sub-zero chill that refrigerates with the same efficacy as a brick of ice.
object.name: Frostheart Phoenix Feather

object.description: Crafted from nightelm trees that once flourished in Ellyrion before being largely destroyed during Asur-Druchii conflicts. If bearer is targeted by spells from Witchcraft, Daemonology, Necromancy, Dark Magic, or any Chaos Lore, they gain Magic Resistance 3 Creature Trait. Sometimes used as shafts for polearms.
object.name: Staff of Nightelm

object.description: Wood harvested from the Eternal Grove of Eataine, where trees are bathed in the Winds of Magic. Grows slowly and produces exceptionally hard wood. Crafting items from this wood suffers -4 SL penalty. Polearms and bows made from this material gain the Durable 4 Quality.
object.name: Staff of the Eternal Grove

object.description: Fragments of shattered waystones or small portable waystones containing Elven soulstuff that protects from predatory gods. Only sold to trusted individuals who will keep them secure. Helps find the nearest waystone and navigate Yvresse mists. Bearer may use it to aid in Yenlui meditation and can make a Challenging (+0) Pray Test to sense the direction of the nearest waystone.
object.name: Wayshard

object.description: Skaven Charm provides him with the Luck 3 Talent. If carried by a non-Skaven character, every hour, it for counts as a Moderate Corrupting Influence.
object.name: Warpstone Charm
